issue.title: [C++][Docs] Create tutorial content for basic Flight usage
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-17378](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17378). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
As per <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IFk6m97JWZZzFC3UIlLf3sxnXgFoL-l89nqSGl8bE28/edit?usp=sharing>, create tutorial content which uses basic concepts to introduce users to Arrow Flight.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17378?focusedCommentId=17578116) by David Li (lidavidm):*
There's also ARROW-6390.

FWIW, I'm willing to carve out some time to start sketching this. Do we think tutorials can just go as new pages in the existing docs?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17378?focusedCommentId=17578118) by Kae Suarez (ksuarez):*
Definitely, we can just make Getting Started a header just under C++ or under C++/User's Guide, and then have everything else from the plotted out Getting Started structure under there.
